column4: I just upgraded to xubuntu 7.10 and now the internet does not work, and usb or cd drives will not mount.
anyone here?
i need help, I just upgraded to xubuntu 7.10 and now the internet does not work, and usb or cd drives will not mount. What is the bash code to get a cd drive to mount?
mount then what, i'm still new at this
I need to be walk throughed
how do i find the device?
ok
it says mount point /mnt/cdrom does not exsist
cua0:it says mount point /mnt/cdrom does not exsist
how can i fix it?
try /media/cdrom
or create some new directory for it yourself.   cd /media; sudo mkdir newDirectoryName
removable drives usually get mounted somewhere under /media in Ubuntu.  doesn't really matter where you put them, but that's the convention
man mount
what?
then you read
i'm trying to save a paper and i don't have much time, can i get a hint?
honestly i don't have the mount command syntax memorized, i'd have to read the man pages, in which case it's probably more efficient for you to read them yourself
ok thanks, if i have any more questions i will ask
cat /etc/fstab
or sudo gedit /etc/fstab
make a backup if you are going to edit it
